item.title: The First Mile of Global Value Chain Governance: Empowering Women and Reducing Gender-Based Violence through Third-Party Interventions
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: other   Topic: Management

Third-party interventions in global value chains can transform women’s lives in fragile contexts, revealing when economic inclusion, leadership opportunities, and social programs genuinely empower women and reduce gender-based violence.

item.title: Data Deficit and Africa-Focused IB Research and Publications
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: journal   Topic: General

This paper discusses the issue of research data deficit, which has been a major obstacle to publishing Africa-focused research in top-tier IB journals, and proffers strategies to address the problem.

item.title: International Regulation and African Multinational Banks: A Paradox for International Business Policy and Sustainable Development
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: other   Topic: International Business

African multinational banks face a paradox: global regulations meant to protect stability are pricing them out of the very markets that most need financial inclusion and growth.

item.title: Globalization in Modern Capitalism: Digital Innovation, MNEs, and Market Entry Strategies
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: other   Topic: International Business

Emerging-market MNEs are reshaping global capitalism through knowledge management, AI-driven business model innovation, digital platforms, and machine learning techniques, achieving rapid internationalization while advancing international business research.

item.title: Sensing, Seizing, Transforming: A Student Perspective on Enhancing IB Doctoral Education for Meaningful Scholarship
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: other   Topic: International Business

How doctoral students can shape their academic trajectories through strategic scaffolding techniques that build capabilities, expand networks, and foster impactful research in an evolving international business landscape.

item.title: The Role of Subnational Investment Promotion Agencies in Supporting Global Energy Transition Policies
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: other   Topic: Sustainability

Global energy transition hinges on local action. This article reveals how subnational Investment Promotion Agencies in Brazil catalyze green investment. Discover the four-pillar framework aligning global sustainability and regional development.

item.title: Choosing to Make International Business Scholarship Matter
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: other   Topic: International Business

IB scholarship matters when we choose to make it matter, by engaging deeply with local and global challenges and by learning to disseminate our work in ways that resonate.

item.title: Letter from the Editors: Making International Business Scholarship Matter
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: journal   Topic: International Business

Building upon the theme Making IB Scholarship Matter, this issue includes articles on Indigenous-owned SMEs, meaningful work, UN SDGs, the AIB-UNCTAD strategic alliance, foreign entry decisions, and IB doctoral education.

item.title: An Interview with AIB 2025 International Executive of the Year James Lawrence
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: other   Topic: International Business

James Lawrence, 2025 AIB International Executive of the Year, discusses his career and what he sees as emerging trends in international business, along with providing advice to international business scholars.

item.title: Letter from the Editors: 2025 Awards Issue Featuring Peter J. Buckley and Mark Casson AIB Dissertation Award Finalists and Interviews with AIB Fellows Award Recipients
item.description:
Region: Global   Type: journal   Topic: International Business

2025 awards issue featuring finalists for the AIB’s prestigious Peter J. Buckley and Mark Casson Dissertation Award and interviews with recipients of the 2025 AIB Fellows Awards.
